MEBEVERINE HYDROCHLORIDE

  • Indications and doses
  • Pregnancy
  • Contra indications
  • Side effects
  • Patient and carer advice
  • Unlicensed use
  • Exceptions to legal category
  • Medicinal forms

Indications and doses

Adjunct in gastro-intestinal disorders characterised by smooth muscle spasm,

By mouth using immediate-release medicines

  • For adults
    135–150 mg 3 times a day, dose preferably taken 20 minutes before meals.
  • For children 10–17 years
    135–150 mg 3 times a day, dose preferably taken 20 minutes before meals.

Irritable bowel syndrome,

By mouth using modified-release medicines

  • For adults
    200 mg twice daily.
  • For children 12–17 years
    200 mg twice daily.

Advice when patient is pregnant

Not known to be harmful—manufacturers advise avoid.

Contra indications

  • Paralytic ileus

Known side effects

General side effects

notKnown: Allergic reactions, angioedema, rash, urticaria,

Advice for patients and carers

Patients or carers should be given advice on the timing of administration of mebeverine hydrochloride tablets and oral suspension.

In children

Medicines for Children leaflet: Mebeverine for intestinal spasm

www.medicinesforchildren.org.uk/mebeverine-for-intestinal-spasms

Unlicensed use

With oral use in children

Tablets and liquid not licensed for use in children under 10 years.

Granules not licensed for use in children under 12 years.

Modified-release capsules not licensed for use in children under 18 years.

Exceptions to legal category

In adults

Mebeverine hydrochloride can be sold to the public for symptomatic relief of irritable bowel syndrome provided that max. single dose is 135 mg and max. daily dose is 405 mg; for uses other than symptomatic relief of irritable bowel syndrome provided that max. single dose is 100 mg and max. daily dose is 300 mg.

Prepared medicinal forms of MEBEVERINE HYDROCHLORIDE

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

Forms available from special-order manufacturers include: powder,
Tablet
Modified-release capsule
Oral suspension
